tit.cmt: ハイフンを削除し、Mikoto としました。

sen.j: 伊豆那姫命（いづなひめのみこと）は高知県土佐清水市高知山の伊豆田神社、南国市田村地区および前浜地区の伊都多神社にて祭られる神。
sen.e: Izunahime-no-mikoto is a god enshrined at Izuta-jinja Shrine (伊豆田神社) in Mt. Kochi, Tosashimizu City, Kochi Prefecture and at Izuta-jinja Shrine (伊都多神社) in Tamura Area and Maehama Area, Nankoku City.
Izunahime-no-mikoto is a goddess enshrined at Izuta-jinja Shrine on Mt. Kochi, Tosashimizu City, Kochi Prefecture and at the Izuta-jinja Shrines in Tamura and Maehama districts of Nankoku City.
sen.cmt: *Revised for clarity - although the kanji highlight the difference between the names, I don't think they'd mean much to the average English speaker
sen.e: Izunahime no Mikoto is a goddess enshrined at Izuta-jinja Shrine on Mt. Kochi, Tosashimizu City, Kochi Prefecture and at the Izuta-jinja Shrines in Tamura and Maehama districts of Nankoku City.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除し、Mikoto としました。

sen.j: 本社である伊豆那神社が江戸時代 幕末期に火災に遭い記録が消失している為に由来などは未詳である。
sen.e: Because its record was lost when a main shrine Izuta-jinja Shrine (伊豆田神社) caught fire in the end of Edo period, detailed description such as origin is unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the records was lost in a fire at the Mt. Kochi Izuta-jinja Shrine, which serves as the main shrine, her origins and other details are unknown.
Because the records were lost in a fire at Izuna-jinja Shrine, which serves as the main shrine, her origins and other details are unknown.

sen.j: しかし、少なくとも室町時代以前から信仰されている産土神(うぶすながみ)である。
sen.e: However, Izunahime-no-mikoto is at least Ubusunagami (guardian deity of one's birthplace) which has been worshipped since Muromachi period or earlier.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Izunahime-no-mikoto has been worshipped as an "ubusunagami" (guardian deity of one's birthplace) since the Muromachi period and earlier.
However, Izunahime no Mikoto has been worshipped as an "ubusunagami" (guardian deity of one's birthplace) since the Muromachi period and earlier.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除し、Mikoto としました。

sen.j: 前浜の伊都多神社では脚気平癒にご利益がある「御伊都多様」として土佐一円で広く崇敬された。
sen.e: Izunahime-no-mikoto at Izuta-jinja Shrine (伊都多神社) in Maehama Area was widely worshipped throughout Tosa province as 'Oizutasama (御伊都多様)' which was said to be responsive to prayer for the cure of the beriberi.
The Izunahime-no-mikoto enshrined at the Maehama Izuta-jinja Shrine was widely worshipped throughout Tosa Province as 'Oizutasama', who was said to answer prayers for a cure to beriberi.
The Izunahime no Mikoto enshrined at the Maehama Izuta-jinja Shrine was widely worshipped throughout Tosa Province as 'Oizutasama,' who was said to answer prayers for a cure to beriberi.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除し、Mikoto としました。

sen.j: また南国市では伊都多神社に祭られる伊豆那姫命は三柱の姉妹神であるとの言い伝えもある。
sen.e: Nankoku City has a legend that Izunahime-no-mikoto enshrined at Izuta-jinja Shrine (伊都多神社) are Mihashira no menokami (three female gods).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Nankoku City, the Izunahime-no-mikoto enshrined at the Izuta-jinja Shrines are traditionally called "Mihashira no menokami" (three sister goddesses).
In Nankoku City, the Izunahime no Mikoto enshrined at the Izuta-jinja Shrines are traditionally called "Mihashira no menokami" (three sister goddesses).
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除し、Mikoto としました。

sen.j: 次女神が前浜・末女神が田村地区の神であり、次女神と末女神が不仲であるとされていたという。
sen.e: It is said that the second-eldest sister god is the one enshrined in Maehama area, that the youngest sister god is the one enshrined in Tamura Area, and that they are on bad terms.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that the second-eldest sister is the one enshrined in the Maehama district, that the youngest sister is the one enshrined in the Tamura district, and that they are on bad terms.
It is said that the second-eldest sister is the one enshrined in the Maehama district, that the youngest sister is the one enshrined in the Tamura district, and that they are on bad terms.
